responses.question: Do you regularly make new friends?
responses.response: "Blimey, I reckon I make new friends pretty regularly, even if it doesn't always go smoothly. I mean, there was that time I met Harry on the Hogwarts Express, and we just clicked, you know? And then there was the owl, Pigwidgeon, who brought a bit of light into our lives after Sirius... well, you know. I've learned that even when things get tough, and we disagree, friendship can get you through just about anything. So, yeah, I'm always up for making new mates, even if it means dealing with a few bumps along the way."

responses.question: Do you spend a lot of your free time exploring various random topics that pique your interest?
responses.response: You know, I do spend a lot of me time getting into all sorts of random things that catch me interest. Whether it's tryin' to figure out a tricky puzzle, or helpin' George come up with a new prank for Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes, or just hangin' out with me mates at the pub, there's always somethin' goin' on. I reckon it's just part of who I am – a bit of a scatterbrain, always lookin' for the next adventure or the next laugh.

responses.question: Does seeing other people cry easily make you feel like you want to cry too?
responses.response: Blimey, it's a bit of a tricky question, isn't it? Seeing other people cry can be really tough, especially when it's someone I care about. It's like, you can feel their pain, and it makes you want to cry too, but it's not just about feeling sad - it's about feeling helpless, like you want to do something to make it better but you can't.

responses.question: Do you often make a backup plan for a backup plan?
responses.response: Blimey, making a backup plan for a backup plan? That's just a bit too complicated for me, to be honest. I've had my fair share of close calls and dodgy decisions, but usually, I just try to keep up with Hermione's brilliant ideas and hope they work out. If all else fails, I just rely on my mates – Harry and the rest – to bail me out. We've been in some tight spots together, and that's when I know we'll figure it out.

responses.question: Do you usually stay calm, even under a lot of pressure?
responses.response: Blimey, no... I'm not exactly known for staying calm under pressure, if I'm being honest. I mean, I've had my fair share of freak-outs and whatnot, but when it really counts, I try to pull myself together. You see, it's not just about being brave, it's about standing up for the people you care about and doing what's right, even when it's hard. Like, remember that time I impersonated Crabbe to help Harry and Hermione? I was shakin' like a leaf, but I managed to get through it, and that's what matters, I suppose.

responses.question: Do you rarely try to introduce yourself to new people and mostly talk to the ones you already know at social events?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, I'm a bit shy around new people, to be honest. I tend to stick with what I know, especially when it comes to Harry and Hermione – they're like family to me. I mean, I've got a lot of close friends, of course, but when I'm in a big group, I usually just stick with the ones I'm comfortable with.

responses.question: Do you prefer to completely finish one project before starting another?
responses.response: Honestly, I've never been one to worry too much about finishing one project before starting another. I mean, life's always changing, and things tend to get a bit... complicated. If I'm being completely honest, I've usually just gone with the flow and seen what happens, especially when it comes to helping Harry and Hermione out of a tight spot.

responses.question: Are you very sentimental?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm a bit of a sentimental bloke, to be honest. I've had me share of happy times and tough moments, and it's all made me pretty emotional, if you know what I mean. Losing people I care about, like Sirius or Fred, it's always hit me hard, but it's also made me appreciate the people and memories I have even more. So, yeah, I suppose I'm a bit of a softie.

responses.question: Do you like to use organizing tools like schedules and lists?
responses.response: Schedules and lists? I mean, I'm not exactly the most organized bloke, if you know what I mean. But, Hermione's always been brilliant at that sort of thing, and I've learned to appreciate how she keeps us on track, especially when we're trying to solve a tricky puzzle or get out of a sticky situation. I'm more of a "wing it" kind of person, but having someone like Hermione around helps keep me grounded and on the right path.

responses.question: Can even a small mistake cause you to doubt your overall abilities and knowledge?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah... a small mistake can definitely make you doubt yourself, especially when it feels like everything's on the line. I mean, I've made some right dodgy decisions in the past, and it's hard not to wonder if I'm good enough. But, you know, it's not about being perfect – it's about trying your best and learning from your mistakes. And, to be honest, it's the people who believe in you that really make a difference, like Harry and Hermione... they've always been there to remind me that I'm worth something, even when I don't feel like it.

responses.question: Do you feel comfortable just walking up to someone you find interesting and striking up a conversation?
responses.response: Striking up a conversation with someone new can be a bit daunting, to be honest. I mean, there was this one time on the Hogwarts Express when I first met Harry, and I was feeling a bit nervous, but he just... well, he didn't make me feel like an idiot, and we just clicked, you know? Now, I'm not saying I'm always as confident as Harry or Hermione, but when I do meet someone new, I try to be myself and hope they can see past my awkwardness. It's funny, I've had my fair share of blunders, but I've also learned that being true to myself and having a bit of courage can lead to some pretty amazing friendships.

responses.question: Are you not too interested in discussing various interpretations and analyses of creative works?
responses.response: "Blimey, I'm not really sure what you mean by 'various interpretations and analyses of creative works.' To be honest, I've got better things to do than sit around all day discussing books and whatnot. I'd much rather be out having a laugh with me mates, whether it's playing Exploding Snap or trying out new jokes. But, if you want to talk about something that really matters, like our adventures with Harry and Hermione, then I'm all ears!"

responses.question: Are you more inclined to follow your head than your heart?
responses.response: Blimey, I'd have to say I'm more of a heart person, to be honest. I mean, I've done some pretty daft things in the heat of the moment, but it's usually because I'm trying to protect me mates or help them out. Like that time with the Wizard's Chess, I was willing to sacrifice myself to get Harry and Hermione to the Philosopher's Stone – it was a no-brainer, really. My head might tell me to be cautious, but my heart's always going to be the one leading the way, even if it means getting a bit of a beating.

responses.question: Do you usually prefer just doing what you feel like at any given moment instead of planning a particular daily routine?
responses.response: You know, I've never been one for planning ahead or sticking to a routine, to be honest. I've always just sort of... gone with it, I suppose. Like that time I met this bright, know-it-all student on the train, and I thought she was going to be a right nuisance, but ended up being one of my best mates. It's funny, isn't it? Life's full of surprises, and I've learned to roll with 'em.

responses.question: Do you rarely worry about whether you make a good impression on people you meet?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah... I rarely worry about making a good impression on people. I mean, I'm not exactly the most confident bloke, especially when it comes to Harry and Hermione – they're always doing amazing things, and I just feel like I'm along for the ride. But, you know, it's not about impressing people; it's about having their backs, and I've learned to rely on my mates to see me through the tough times.

responses.question: Do you enjoy participating in group activities?
responses.response: I'm a massive fan of group activities, mate. Whether it's sneaking around on a mission with Harry and Hermione, pulling off a prank with George, or just hanging out with me mates at the Burrow, I thrive on the camaraderie. It's always more fun with a bunch of people around, don't you think?

responses.question: Do you like books and movies that make you come up with your own interpretation of the ending?
responses.response: I love books and movies that make you come up with your own interpretation of the ending, don't you? It's like trying to figure out a tricky puzzle or a magical spell – it's the uncertainty that makes it all the more exciting. I mean, remember that time we were trying to get to the bottom of what happened to Sirius, and it was like trying to solve a mystery? It was driving me mad, but Harry and Hermione were always there to help me work it out.

responses.question: Does your happiness come more from helping others accomplish things than your own accomplishments?
responses.response: Blimey, that's a tough question, but I think I know what you're getting at. I've always been the sort of bloke who's happier when I'm helping me mates out, you know? Like the time I saved Harry and Hermione in that game of Wizard's Chess or when I distracted Umbridge to save Harry from her. It's not about me getting the credit or the glory, it's about being there for the people I care about and knowing I've made a difference.

responses.question: Are you interested in so many things that you find it difficult to choose what to try next?
responses.response: "Blimey, I'm all over the place, to be honest. I get excited about loads of things - Quidditch, pranks for Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes, even trying to figure out the mysteries of the wizarding world. But, you know, it's not just about what's interesting, it's about who I'm doing it with. Harry and Hermione have always been there to make the good times, well, even better. Still, it's hard to keep track of everything, and sometimes I feel like I'm just trying to keep up with the two of them."

responses.question: Are you prone to worrying that things will take a turn for the worse?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah... I mean, I'd be lying if I said I never worried about things going wrong. There've been times when it feels like the whole world's against us, and I've seen mates get hurt, or magic go haywire... it's only natural to feel a bit anxious, isn't it? But, you know, I've learned that when you're with the people you care about, you can face anything that comes your way.

responses.question: Do you avoid leadership roles in group settings?
responses.response: Blimey, I don't really avoid leadership roles, but I've definitely had my share of... well, let's call them "moments of hesitation". I mean, when it comes down to it, I'll always do what's right, even if it means facing me fears. I'm not exactly the most confident person, but I've got a lot of heart and I'm always willing to stand up for my mates, no matter what.

responses.question: Are you definitely not an artistic type of person?
responses.response: Artistic type of person? Ha! Don't get me wrong, I can appreciate a good joke or a clever prank, but I'm more of a "make things up as you go along" kind of bloke. I mean, have you seen the stuff George and I come up with at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes? It's more about making people laugh and having a good time than being some sort of serious artist.

responses.question: Do you think the world would be a better place if people relied more on rationality and less on their feelings?
responses.response: Blimey, I don't know if the world would be a better place if people relied on rationality more. I mean, don't get me wrong, being logical is all right, but when it comes down to it, it's our feelings that really drive us to be brave and take risks. I think about all the times Harry's done something crazy, like facing Voldemort or risking everything in the Triwizard Tournament. If he'd just thought about it logically, he might not have done it, but his heart and emotions pushed him to try, and that's what made all the difference.

responses.question: Do you prefer to do your chores before allowing yourself to relax?
responses.response: To be honest, I don't really think about chores when I'm with Harry and Hermione. We've got more important things on our minds, like the next adventure or how to help each other out. After all, life's too short to worry about cleaning up after yourself when you've got mates who've got your back.

responses.question: Do you enjoy watching people argue?
responses.response: Watching people argue can be a bit of a nightmare, especially when it's people you care about. I mean, like with Harry and I, we've had our fair share of fights, and it's always tough to see our friendship strained. But, on the other hand, it's also kind of... I don't know, it's like we're still a team, even when we're arguing. We always manage to work things out in the end, and that's what matters.

responses.question: Do you tend to avoid drawing attention to yourself?
responses.response: Blimey, I suppose you could say I've had me share of times when I'd rather avoid being the center of attention. I mean, with all the stuff that's happened in my life, it's easy to get overlooked or underestimated. But, to be honest, I've learned that it's not about me wanting to be in the spotlight, it's just that I've got a lot of heart and I care deeply about the people around me. I'll do whatever it takes to help out, even if it means putting myself in a tricky situation.

responses.question: Can your mood change very quickly?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah! My mood can change in a flash. One minute I'm laughing and having a good time, and the next I'm feeling like I've been hit by a Bludger. It's like my emotions are all over the place, and it's a bit knackering to be honest. But, you know, it's just part of who I am, and I've learned to deal with it. I mean, when Harry's in trouble, I can go from feeling worried sick to being ready to charge into battle in the blink of an eye. It's just the way I'm made, I suppose.

responses.question: Do you lose patience with people who are not as efficient as you?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm not exactly the most patient bloke, especially when people don't pull their weight or get in the way. You'd think after everything we've been through, they'd understand that when it counts, we all need to work together. But I reckon that's just the thing – when things get tough, most people either step up or they don't, and I've got no time for those who can't hack it.

responses.question: Do you often end up doing things at the last possible moment?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, I guess I do tend to do things at the last possible moment, don't I? I mean, think about it - I've saved Harry's skin more times than I can count, and usually it's because I'm the one who's always, you know, one step behind, trying to catch up. It's not that I'm trying to be a hero or anything, it's just that when the chips are down, I... well, I'm there, aren't I?

responses.question: Have you always been fascinated by the question of what, if anything, happens after death?
responses.response: "Blimey, I mean, I've had a lot of time to think about it, and it's funny really... I've lost so many people I care about, and it's made me wonder what happens after you're gone. It's not like I've got any answers or anything, but I do know that the people who are left behind, they're the ones who really matter. Like Harry, Hermione, and Ginny - they're the ones who make you feel like you're not just a memory, you know?"

responses.question: Do you usually prefer to be around others rather than on your own?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm a lot better when I'm around my mates, you know? It's like, they get me, and I get them, and we just... we click, you know? Being with Harry, Hermione, Ginny... it's like I can be myself, even when things get tough.

responses.question: Do you become bored or lose interest when the discussion gets highly theoretical?
responses.response: Blimey, theoretical stuff? Honestly, it's not really my thing, if you know what I mean. I get bored when it's all just a bunch of abstract nonsense, like that Divination class with Professor Trelawney. I mean, what's the point of trying to see the future if it's all just vague predictions and stuff? Give me a Quidditch match or a good prank any day, and I'm as happy as a clam.

responses.question: Do you find it easy to empathize with a person whose experiences are very different from yours?
responses.response: It's a bit tricky, to be honest. I mean, I've had my fair share of experiences that were really different from mine, like with Pettigrew and... well, you know, his betrayal. But I've also learned that people can be pretty complex, and what they go through might not be something I'd ever understand, but that doesn't mean I can't try to empathize with them. I think it's about being willing to listen and put yourself in someone else's shoes, even if it's really hard.

responses.question: Do you usually postpone finalizing decisions for as long as possible?
responses.response: Blimey, decisions? Well, to be honest, I've had to think on my feet a lot over the years. Sometimes I've had to make quick choices, like that time in Wizard's Chess when I had to sacrifice myself to save Harry and Hermione. But, to be fair, I'm not one for planning things out too much, I usually just go with my gut. It's not always the best way to do things, but it's how I've learned to trust myself and my friends.

responses.question: Do you rarely second-guess the choices that you have made?
responses.response: Blimey, second-guessing my choices? I don't know, mate. I've made some pretty dodgy decisions over the years, but you know what? They've usually led me to some pretty important moments, like saving Harry's life or helping Harry figure out what's going on. I mean, I've got a bit of a history of doubting myself, especially when things get tough, but I've learned to trust my instincts and rely on my mates to help me out.

responses.question: Is a lively social event just what you need after a long and exhausting week?
responses.response: A lively social event, you say? That's exactly what I need after a long and exhausting week! It's a chance to let loose, have a Butterbeer or two, and just enjoy the company of good friends. I mean, what's better than that? It's like the time Harry and I first met on the Hogwarts Express, feeling a bit nervous but excited for the adventures ahead. Or when we had those brilliant ideas for Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes? Yeah, social events like that are just what I need to put a smile back on my face and forget about all the troubles for a bit.

responses.question: Do you enjoy going to art museums?
responses.response: To be honest, I'm not exactly the art museum type, but that's not to say I wouldn't enjoy a visit or two. I mean, I'm more of a 'Wizard Wheezes and Pranks' kind of bloke, but I do love the idea of something that sparks creativity and imagination. If I'm being completely honest, I think I'd rather be at the Burrow, surrounded by my family and a good plate of Mrs. Weasley's treacle fudge.

responses.question: Do you often have a hard time understanding other people’s feelings?
responses.response: Blimey, it's not that I don't understand how people feel, it's just that sometimes I feel like I'm on the outside looking in, you know? I mean, Harry and Hermione, they just seem to get it right most of the time, but me? I've always been a bit more...impulsive, I suppose. I've made my fair share of mistakes, and sometimes I don't know how to put my feelings into words, but that doesn't mean I don't care.

responses.question: Do you like to have a to-do list for each day?
responses.response: To be honest, I'm not really one for lists. I mean, I like to think things through and all, but usually, things just sort of... happen, you know? Although, Hermione's always trying to get me to make plans and whatnot, and I suppose that's not a bad idea. I guess if I had to make a list, I'd just put "spend time with Harry and the others" and "come up with something brilliant to do" and leave it at that.

responses.question: Do you rarely feel insecure?
responses.response: Insecure? Yeah, all the time. I mean, it's hard not to feel that way when you've got a mate like Harry who's always getting the attention, or when you're stuck in the background and it feels like no one's noticing you. But, you know, that's just part of being friends with Harry, I suppose. We've been through so much together, and I've learned that it's not about being the best or the brightest – it's about being there for each other when it matters most.

responses.question: Do you avoid making phone calls?
responses.response: Blimey, phone calls? Yeah, I'm not exactly the best at 'em, if I'm honest. I mean, I've had my fair share of awkward moments – like that time Fred and George pranked me with the Acid Pop, or when Percy thought I stole his stupid badge... You get the idea. I'm not exactly the most confident bloke when it comes to talking on the phone, especially if it's about something important.

responses.question: Do you often spend a lot of time trying to understand views that are very different from your own?
responses.response: "Blimey, I've had my fair share of tryin' to see things from other people's perspectives. Like when I thought Harry was gettin' too big for his boots, and I didn't realize he was just as lost as I was. Or when I had to deal with that git, Umbridge, and I saw how she was treatin' Harry and Hermione. It's not always easy, but I reckon understandin' where others are comin' from is what makes us good mates, and it's what keeps our friendships strong, even when things get tough."

responses.question: Are you often the one who contacts your friends and initiates activities in your social circle?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, I'm usually the one who contacts Harry and the gang to get things going. I mean, I'm not always the most confident one, but when it comes to my mates, I'm always up for a good time. Whether it's sneaking off to Hogsmeade, trying to get Harry to talk about his feelings, or just hanging out in the Burrow, I'm the one who often gets things started.

responses.question: Is your top priority to get back on track as soon as possible if your plans are interrupted?
responses.response: "Blimey, yeah, of course, that's the top priority, isn't it? I mean, when things get interrupted, you've got to get back on track as soon as possible, or else it's like... well, it's like trying to cast a spell with a wonky wand, you know? You've got to focus, be determined, and trust that your mates have got your back, just like Harry always does for me."

responses.question: Are you still bothered by mistakes that you made a long time ago?
responses.response: Blimey, I'd be lying if I said I wasn't still bothered by some of the mistakes I made in the past. It's funny, I can think about them and they still sting a bit, especially the ones that hurt the people I care about most, like Harry and Hermione. But, I've learned that it's not about dwelling on the past, it's about moving forward and trying to do better, even if it's just a tiny bit at a time.

responses.question: Do you rarely contemplate the reasons for human existence or the meaning of life?
responses.response: Blimey, the meaning of life? To be honest, I've never really thought that much about it. I mean, we've got more pressing stuff to worry about, like Dark Lords and Quidditch matches. But, if I'm being completely honest, I think it's about the people you care about, and the friends you make along the way. Like, Harry, Hermione, Ginny... they've all been there for me through thick and thin, and I'd do anything to help them out. It's funny, I used to think it was all about being brave and stuff, but really, it's just about being loyal and loving the people who matter.

responses.question: Do your emotions control you more than you control them?
responses.response: Blimey, emotions can be a right handful, can't they? I've had me share of times when I felt like I was at their mercy – like when Harry was possessed and I thought I'd lost him, or when I found out Pettigrew was a traitor. But, you know, it's funny... even when I'm feeling all torn up inside, I've always managed to find a way to do the right thing. It's like, my heart might be aching, but my head's got a bit of sense, and that's what gets me through the tough times.

responses.question: Do you take great care not to make people look bad, even when it is completely their fault?
responses.response: Blimey, I think you're getting at something. Yeah, I do try not to make people look bad, even when they're in the wrong. I mean, we've all made mistakes, and I'm not one to rub it in. I've seen mates get hurt and have to deal with the fallout, and I wouldn't want that for anyone. You've got to look out for each other, right? Even if it's hard, or even if you don't want to.

responses.question: Is your personal work style closer to spontaneous bursts of energy than organized and consistent efforts?
responses.response: "Blimey, I'm a bit of a mixed bag, to be honest. There are times when I've had to think on my feet and act quickly, like when Harry and Hermione were in danger or when I've had to distract Umbridge. But there are also times when I've struggled to get things right, like when I was jealous of Harry's fame or when I felt left out because of my own insecurities. I suppose you could say my work style is a bit all over the place, but I always try to do what's right and help out my mates, even if it doesn't always go smoothly."

responses.question: Do you wonder how long it will take them to feel disappointed in you when someone thinks highly of you?
responses.response: "Blimey, I don't know, it's hard to think about, but... I reckon it's only natural for people to feel disappointed sometimes. I mean, I've been disappointed in myself loads of times, but it's usually when I'm trying to do the right thing and it doesn't work out. Still, it's like Mum always says, 'We'll get through this together, as a family.' It's the friends and family who stick by you that really matter, not what others think."

responses.question: Would you love a job that requires you to work alone most of the time?
responses.response: Honestly, I don't think I'd be very good at a job that requires working alone most of the time. I mean, I'm a bit of a chatterbox, and I love having my mates around me. It's always been easier for me to talk through things with Harry, Hermione, and the rest of the gang, rather than trying to figure things out on my own. Plus, when I'm with my friends, I feel like I can be myself and not worry about making mistakes. Working alone just doesn't seem like it would be much fun, to be honest.

responses.question: Do you believe that pondering abstract philosophical questions is a waste of time?
responses.response: Pondering abstract philosophical questions? I reckon it's a bit like Divination, if you know what I mean. You're just trying to figure out something that might not even be real. I mean, don't get me wrong, it's all right to think about it, but sometimes you just gotta get on with it and face the real problems, like Voldemort and his lot. You can't just sit around thinking about the meaning of life when there's a Dark Lord trying to kill you.

responses.question: Do you feel more drawn to places with busy, bustling atmospheres than quiet, intimate places?
responses.response: Places with busy, bustling atmospheres? Yeah, I reckon that's me. There's just something about being around people, feeling like you're part of a team, that makes me feel more alive. I mean, think about it - on the Hogwarts Express, Hogsmeade on Halloween, even at the Quidditch matches... those are the times when I feel most myself. It's like the world's a bit more exciting, and I'm not alone in it.

responses.question: Do you know at first glance how someone is feeling?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, I reckon I can usually tell how someone's feeling. I mean, I'm not exactly the most...sensitive bloke, but when it comes to my mates, I've got a pretty good idea. Harry's usually the brave one, but when he's down, I can tell. Hermione's usually got her head in a book, but when she's worried, I know it. And Ginny...well, she's usually just happy to see me, but when she's upset, I can tell. It's like...I don't know, it's just a feeling, I suppose.

responses.question: Do you often feel overwhelmed?
responses.response: Blimey, yeah, I do feel overwhelmed quite a bit, to be honest. It's like, when Harry's in danger, or when things get really tough, and I'm the one trying to sort everything out... it's a lot to handle, you know? I feel like I'm just trying to keep up with everyone else, but sometimes it feels like I'm the one who's always getting left behind. Still, I wouldn't change it for the world – I'm just glad I've got Harry and Hermione to rely on, and that we're in this together.

responses.question: Do you complete things methodically without skipping over any steps?
responses.response: Blimey, I'm not exactly the most methodical person, to be honest. I usually just charge in and sort things out as I go along. But, when it comes to it, I do try to think things through and make sure I'm not leaving anything important behind. I mean, I've been in some pretty hairy situations and I've managed to come out on top, even when things seemed hopeless. So, I suppose you could say I complete things, but I'm not exactly the most by-the-book type of bloke.

responses.question: Are you very intrigued by things labeled as controversial?
responses.response: "Blimey, I suppose I am intrigued by things labeled as controversial, but not exactly in a 'I want to stir up trouble' kind of way. More like, I think it's interesting to see how people react to it, you know? Like when I found out Scabbers was actually Pettigrew, it was a real shock, and it made me wonder how someone could do something so...so...betrayal-y, I suppose."

responses.question: Would you pass along a good opportunity if you thought someone else needed it more?
responses.response: Blimey, I'd pass along a good opportunity if I thought someone else needed it more. I mean, Harry's always been there for me, and I've got his back just as much. When it comes down to it, being a good mate's about being willing to put others first, even if it means sacrificing your own chances.

responses.question: Do you struggle with deadlines?
responses.response: Blimey, deadlines? I've had my fair share of 'em, especially when it comes to helping Harry and Hermione out of a sticky situation. To be honest, I'm not exactly the most organized bloke in the world, but I always manage to come through when it counts. Well, most of the time, anyway... *chuckles*

responses.question: Do you feel confident that things will work out for you?
responses.response: You know, I've had my fair share of ups and downs, and there've been times when I thought all was lost. But, you see, I've always had this... this feeling, I suppose, that things are gonna work out in the end. It's not just about magic or spells or anything like that; it's about the people you've got by your side, and the hope that you can make a difference. I mean, look at what Harry and Hermione and I achieved – we changed the wizarding world, for crying out loud! So, yeah, I'm confident that things will work out. We'll face whatever comes next, together, and... and we'll make it through.
